intro: Sidalcea setosa subsp. querceta, commonly known as the oakleaf silversword, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its silver-gray, woolly foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Its subspecific name, *querceta*, refers to its resemblance to oak leaves, highlighting its distinctive leaf morphology.
